alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 1:49AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WARREN COUNTY THROUGH 230 AM EDT... At 148 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles southwest of Jamestown to 13 miles east of Meadville. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Warren, Sheffield, Columbus, Youngsville, Russell, Spring Creek, Scandia, Lottsville, Grand Valley, Warren South, Garland, Kinzua Dam, Chapman State Park, Tidioute, Sugar Grove, Starbrick, Clarendon and Bear Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
